section: In the event that the parties are unable to agree to an SOW within 2 months following the Effective Date, either party may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement by providing written notice. Once approved, the parties shall use commercially reasonable efforts to diligently implement their respective obligations under the SOW.
explanation: This section outlines that the parties must agree to the SOW within 2 months or either party can terminate. However, it does not specify what happens if one party refuses to negotiate in good faith or delays the approval of the SOW. This creates a loophole where a party could avoid their obligations simply by delaying the SOW, undermining the intent of good faith negotiations.

section: The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: The renewal clause states that the agreement is automatically renewed for another year if neither party gives notice of non-renewal. However, it also states renewal requires 'mutual written agreement,' creating a contradiction. Automatic renewal without a new written agreement seems inconsistent with the requirement of a 'mutual written agreement'.

section: Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party.
explanation: The language 'to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party' is vague and could significantly limit the scope of indemnification. It's unclear under what circumstances the Indemnified Party would be deemed a principal, creating potential disputes over the actual extent of indemnification coverage.
